bioghist.p: Abraham Peter Hankins (1904-1963) was born in Gomel, Russia. He was sent to the United States in 1914 to live with his cousins and study at the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts and the Philadelphia Museum College of Art. Hankins served in the U.S. Army during World War I. After the war, he studied at the Academy Julien and worked privately with M. de Montholon. Returning to Philadelphia, he attended the Philadelphia Museum School of Art, the Barnes Foundation, and the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts. His work is in the collections of the Philadelphia Museum of Art, the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts, the Free Library of Philadelphia and the Barnes Foundation.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of etchings, aquatints, serigraphs, monotypes, woodcuts, and pastels by Abraham P. Hankins. The collection also includes a sketchbook kept by Hankins, several watercolors and a few sketches.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
